definition: sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)

sentences.english: Victor has a very good voice and plays the violin very well.
sentences.chinese: 维特有一口好嗓音，而且小提琴也拉得很棒。

sentences.english: She listened to the deep tone of Xu Huabei's voice.
sentences.chinese: 她听着徐华北低沉的嗓音。

sentences.english: I don't like the way they husked the songs.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜欢他们那种以粗哑的嗓音唱歌的方法。

sentences.english: He had a beautiful deep voice, and played an instrument called a banjo.
sentences.chinese: 他有着一副低沉动听的嗓音，还会弹奏班卓琴。

sentences.english: Esquire magazine named her the best voice in the history of pop music.
sentences.chinese: 君子杂志称她的嗓音是流行音乐历史上最好的声音。

sentences.english: There's still another reason she choose CRI.
sentences.chinese: 她来到国际台还有一个原因是她有美丽的嗓音。

sentences.english: Ice chilly voice, let people have a tiny heart palpitates.
sentences.chinese: 冰寒的嗓音，让人有点心悸。

sentences.english: She changed teachers instead, and after two years of retraining her damaged voice, Olivero was on her way.
sentences.chinese: 在对被破坏的嗓音重新训练了两年之后开始走向成功。
他的嗓音亲切而又甜美。

sentences.english: Your very voice is in my heartbeat, sweeter than my dream.
sentences.chinese: 你独特的嗓音铭刻在我爱的心跳里，比梦还甜。

sentences.english: She implored piteously a voice choked with sobs.
sentences.chinese: 她用哽咽了的嗓音苦苦哀求。

sentences.english: Probably the songs most defining feature is the vocal talent.
sentences.chinese: 这首曲子也最能突出她那天生的好嗓音。

sentences.english: She is attractive, effervescent and has an appealing voice.
sentences.chinese: 她迷人而又充满活力，她的嗓音动人甜美。

sentences.english: The boy has a clear voice – when he sings it's beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 这男孩子嗓音清脆，唱起歌来悦耳动听。

sentences.english: Nothing swaggered with a raucous noise to disarrange the perfect harmony.
sentences.chinese: 没有任何东西以粗哑刺耳的嗓音拢乱这完美的和谐。

definition: singing voice/fig. original voice of a poet
high-pitched and penetrating (musical instrument, voice etc)/high-spirited/fever-pitched (atmosphere)
pitch of voice (high or low)/pitch (of a musical note)/tone
